articles.title: Trump trial nightmare? Senate hears Giuliani's Ukraine trip 'baggage'
articles.description: Trump lawyer Rudy Giuliani recently returned to Ukraine to meet with figures caught up in the story that led to Pres. Trump’s impeachment — and Giuliani brought cameras. He took the trip in coordination with conservative outlet OAN, which Trump has praised, a…

articles.title: Bloomberg outpaces all Democrats in ad spending
articles.description: NBC's Stephanie Ruhle on the latest from the Bloomberg campaign and if they regret skipping early states.

articles.title: New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo's nostalgic attempt to capture his...
articles.description: A hint of nostalgia follows New York Governor Andrew Cuomo’s latest campaign poster.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: A 'sober, joyless moment': Fmr. Sen. Byron Dorgan describes Clinton impeachment trial
articles.description: Former Senator Byron Dorgan (D-N.D.) on serving as a juror in the Clinton impeachment trial.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Friday's Mini-Report, 1.10.20
articles.content:
Today’s edition of quick hits:
* Impeachment: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, D-Calif., said in a letter to Democratic lawmakers on Friday that she will consult with them Tuesday as she announced steps to send the articles of impeachment to the Senate.
* Pointl… [+2408 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump offers new explanation for Soleimani killing
articles.description: Trump defends order to kill Iranian general, now saying Soleimani was targeting ‘four embassies,’ as lawmakers say they were never briefed on that intel

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Mike Bloomberg’s campaign to troll Trump until election day
articles.description: Mike Bloomberg vows to keep his campaign apparatus in place even if he doesn’t win the nomination, to help whoever is taking on Trump

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: When would the Senate impeachment trial begin?
articles.description: NBC News Correspondent Geoff Bennett joins MTP Daily to discuss the latest from the Hill today and what to expect next in the impeachment trial.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Speaker Pelosi to send articles of impeachment to the Senate next week
articles.description: A look at the updates from today - Speaker Nancy Pelosi tells Democratic caucus to prepare to transmit articles of impeachment as soon as next week.

articles.title: Trump moves to roll back landmark environmental law
articles.description: President Trump sees federal environmental regulation as “big government at its absolute worst.” Jody Freeman, Director of the Harvard Law School Environmental and Energy Law Program, joins Ali Velshi to discuss what’s at stake now that President Trump has pr…

articles.title: Rep. Crenshaw: Rightful questions have been raised, answered
articles.description: The House of Representatives adopted a war powers resolution intended to limit President Trump's military actions against Iran. Republican Congressman Dan Crenshaw, a former Navy SEAL who served in Iraq and Afghanistan and sits on the Homeland Security Commit…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Iraqi PM calls on U.S. to set up plan for troop withdrawal
articles.description: Iraq’s Prime Minister wants a U.S. delegation to come to Baghdad to establish a plan to withdraw U.S. troops.  Ali Velshi talks about the significance of this tension with Mara Karlin, Director of Strategic Studies at the Johns Hopkins School of Advanced Inte…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Rep. Smith: Pelosi withholding articles of impeachment was 'absolutely worth doing'
articles.description: Rep. Adam Smith, D-Wash., told Katy Tur that he supported Speaker Nancy Pelosi's decision to withhold the articles of impeachment from the Senate to ensure a fair trial.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Gaetz, two other Republicans break rank to vote with Democrats on war powers
articles.description: Nicolle Wallace and the panel discuss the three Republicans who broke rank and voted with House Democrats on the war powers resolution that aims to limit President Donald Trump's military actions against Iran.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: The 400 bills waiting for the Senate
articles.description: The House has sent more than 400 bills to the Senate. So why are they just collecting dust on Mitch McConnell's desk? Illinois Democratic Congresswoman Robin Kelly joins Katy Tur to discuss.
